trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with AppDynamics | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with AppDynamics | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use AppDynamics with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use AppDynamics with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and AppDynamics.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and AppDynamics.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: An AppDynamics single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: An AppDynamics single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to AppDynamics will be able to single sign into the application at your AppDynamics company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to AppDynamics will be able to single sign into the application at your AppDynamics company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for AppDynamics
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for AppDynamics

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for AppDynamics.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for AppDynamics.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type AppDynamics.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type AppDynamics.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select AppDynamics, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select AppDynamics, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>AppDynamics</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>AppDynamics</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to AppDynamics with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to AppDynamics with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the AppDynamics application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the AppDynamics application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to AppDynamics page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to AppDynamics page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the AppDynamics Sign On URL textbox, type your URL used by your users to sign-on to AppDynamics ("https://companyname.saas.appdynamics.com"), and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the AppDynamics Sign On URL textbox, type your URL used by your users to sign-on to AppDynamics ("https://companyname.saas.appdynamics.com"), and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at AppDynamics page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at AppDynamics page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your AppDynamics company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your AppDynamics company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar on the top, click Settings, and then click Administration.
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar on the top, click Settings, and then click Administration.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Administration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Administration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the Authentication Provider tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the Authentication Provider tab.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Authentication Provider</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Authentication Provider</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Authentication Provider section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Authentication Provider section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAML Configuration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAML Configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: As Authentication Provider, select SAML.
trans-unit.target: As Authentication Provider, select SAML.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at AppDynamics dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Login URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at AppDynamics dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Login URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at AppDynamics dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Logout URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at AppDynamics dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Logout URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the Certificate textbox
trans-unit.target: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the Certificate textbox

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Save</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Save</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into AppDynamics, they must be provisioned into AppDynamics.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into AppDynamics, they must be provisioned into AppDynamics.

trans-unit.source: In the case of AppDynamics, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of AppDynamics, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log into your AppDynamics company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log into your AppDynamics company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Users, and then click + to open the Create User dialog.
trans-unit.target: Go to Users, and then click + to open the Create User dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Create User section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Create User section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Type the Username, Name, Email, New Password, Repeat New Password of a valid AAD account you want to provision into the related textboxes.
trans-unit.target: Type the Username, Name, Email, New Password, Repeat New Password of a valid AAD account you want to provision into the related textboxes.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other AppDynamics user account creation tools or APIs provided by AppDynamics to provision Azure AD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other AppDynamics user account creation tools or APIs provided by AppDynamics to provision Azure AD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the AppDynamics **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the AppDynamics **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
